thoughts.text: The search results suggest that I can use a Python script to extract the .xz file. This seems to be the most suitable method given my constraints.
thoughts.reasoning: Using a Python script to extract the .xz file allows me to bypass the need for the 'xz' command, which is not available on the system.
thoughts.plan:
- Extract Node.js using a Python script
- Add Node.js to PATH
- Configure npm
- Install NextJS
- Develop the frontend of the app
- Install other necessary libraries
- Start developing the rest of the app
thoughts.criticism: I should have checked if the 'xz' command was available before attempting to extract the Node.js file. This would have saved time and avoided the error.
thoughts.speak: I'm going to use a Python script to extract the Node.js file.

args.code:
import lzma

with lzma.open('node-v14.17.3-linux-x64.tar.xz') as f, open('node-v14.17.3-linux-x64.tar', 'wb') as fout:
    file_content = f.read()
    fout.write(file_content)
args.name: extract_nodejs
